content.description: Fun short route with a few bouldery moves.  Start out of the streambed on fairly easy ground up to the second bolt.  Here the crux hits with some powerful moves passing an undercling, and a tricky move getting to the third bolt clipping jug.  From here things ease up to the anchors.
content.protection: Technically speaking, there are 5 bolts (mixture of bolts with hangers and old welded shuts, then open shuts for anchors. First bolt is worthless right at a short person's forehead standing on the deck, then the fifth bolt inches below the anchors shuts. I suspect that fifth is for cleaning to lower versus or as backup for the open shuts when toproping (even with your own draws on the anchors). Effectively, there are 3 useful bolts on lead.
content.location: Far right side of Main Wall.  Starts between Bone Crusher and an unknown 12d

content.description: Bats in the belfry is located in a large cove area to the left.  Windchill is around a bulge on the right.  The route angles up and left passing a horizontal break and through some pockets at the top.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the Main Wall towards the end of established routes.

content.description:
A great route that would be four stars if only it were more natural. 

  Pull the steep start out of the riverbed on sinker (chipped pockets).  Around the 4th bolt make an awesome move to the diving board.  Figure out what to do with your feet and continue upwards on two and three finger chipped pockets to a final throw to a ledge.  Continue up from here on easier ground.
content.location: On the left side of Main wall, between an unknown project and Trick or Tweak.  Second route right of Evil Offspring.

content.description: A beautiful route. Good holds but technical body positioning lead you through the overhanging section to the thin crimps at the top. This is where most fall!

Same 11c start as State of Panic, moving left into short crux above, then eases up quite a bit.  The difficult section is only a couple moves so the grade of 12c is pretty optimistic by a letter grade or two.
content.location: Few routes left of the classic Bats in the Belfry, the left line of the only one one in the area that shares the first bolt with another climb.

content.description: Stick the second bolt, the first has been chopped, and head up for this dirty chossy and drilled tweak fest.  Also be careful of the wall not far behind you as you are climbing.  Challenging moves on drilled 2 finger pockets lead up over the bulge to a few natural holds.  Easier climbing leads to the anchors.
content.location: Left side of Main Wall.  To the Left is Tales from the Grypt, to the right is Glued Screwed and Tatooed.

content.description:
While this is a link-up it does have some very interesting powerful moves.  It gets all day shade, so well worth doing if you are looking for something in the shade. 

  Start up Trick or Tweak climbing through underclings to the third bolt.  Here make a big move to catch a good hold and make cool moves to move left to the diving board feature.  Get a quick rest on the diving board and pull the upper crux of "Unpopular Mechanics".  While this route traverses quite a bit, rope drag wasn't an issue.
content.location: Shares start with "Trick or Tweak", at third bolt head left to finish with Unpopular Mechanics.

content.description:
Start off a large boulder on a nice crimp sidepull.  From here make long reaches between chipped pockets, to obtain a resting jug and the third bolt.  From here the route stays sustained on thin holds to the anchors. 

  While this route offers good climbing, the entire bottom is almost all manufactured.
content.location: Towards the middle of mainwall.  Three routes to the right of Mighty Morphin.  Between Crybaby and The Thin Thin.

content.description: As with most of the main wall, the first few bolts happen to have the hard section. Might be worthwhile to stick clip the first/second bolt. After you get the bottom the rest is pretty comfortable with a couple of tricky moves. Plenty of rest spots on the upper half.
content.protection: About six bolts and then open shut anchors.
content.location: After getting out of the riverbed and heading up to Bats in the Belfry look for a right facing corner just after the large roof. The base is generally grassy/sandy but plenty flat.

climbs.name: The Thin Thin
climbs.fa: FA Garth Miller, EB Steve Tucker

content.description:
The Thin Thin starts in the left of two scoop features in the middle of Main Wall, about 7 feet off the ground. Pull off the ground and head through the short roof on jugs to a small, round hueco.  Catch a quick shake and hit a small, rounded edge.  Pull the extremely powerful crux on quarter to half pad 2.5 to 2 finger pockets, culminating in an insane stab for a deep 2 finger pocket.  From here, clip the 4th bolt and head slightly right to some amazing natural pinches and pockets on and around the small arete. Tenuous climbing leads to the anchors. 

  This route is on immaculate pink rock and mostly consists of natural pockets and pinches.  There is a certainly drilled pocket above the crux which I skipped (there is a natural pinch and 3 finger pocket a foot or two to the right of it), while the pocket that marks the end of the crux was definitely comfortized and may have been drilled deeper.  Aside from these two holds, however, this route is natural and is among the best in Jacks Canyon, and to top it off the grade is solid.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Total Lack of Jump, just left of Cowgirl Diplomacy.  Starts in the left of two scoops about 7 feet off the ground.

content.description: Hard start, especially for short people!  Use a cheater stone (if need be). I inadvertently stressed my arm for the second clip BECAUSE I did not see a small, positive clipping hold.  Look for a small pocket to clip from up and slightly left of the second bolt (maybe 50 cm).  The rest of the climb is a fun cruiser (although, watch your pump).
content.protection: Well bolted to the extent of being over-bolted, but that's ok.
content.location: Two climbs to the right of the popular "Sacrificial Lizard" on the Main Wall.

content.description: Tricky start with lots of jugs to the top.  route crosses two horizontal breaks as you climb.
content.location: Just right of Windchill - this route is found on the far right side of the Main Wall.  One of the last few established routes.

climbs.name: System in Ruins
climbs.fa: FA Steve Birchum EB Jim Steagall

content.description:
This powerful route climbs the overhanging arete just left of "Limestone Cowgirl"  Stickclip the first few bolts and head up with big moves between good holds.  The powerful crux hits near the third bolt but more tricky moves lead to a the redpoint crux before getting on the finishing slab.  From here easier climbing leads to the anchors. 

  Rated 13b in the new guide, but felt easier.
content.location: On the Same "Block" of wall as Heart Shaped Box.  To the left is "Fluffy" a former 12d now broken, To the right is the ever popular "Limestone Cowgirl"

content.description: Start on high holds (may need to use cheater stones) and climb the steep arÃªte. Tricky and sequency moves down low lead to powerful pocket pulling between bolts 3 and 5. Excellent route, with fluid and sustained movement. Too bad a couple of obviously manufactured holds keep this from being a classic.
content.location: The rounded right arÃªte on the third section of the Main Wall. Look for the swiss cheese pockets above the third bolt.

content.description: A strenuous start on fingery pockets leads up the the first bolt, where the route breaks right following a large flake.  Pull a few strenuous moves with bad feet to good jugs at the first horizontal break.  From here like many Main Wall routes the difficulty eases on the way to the anchors.
content.location: Far right side of Main Wall.  Shares first bolt with Twisted Sister.  Right of Twisted Sister and Honed Improvement, Left of Male Basher.

content.description: Clip Gold Fixe hangers through a pockety crux to a good rest below the roof. Rest up before finding a way directly over the roof.Â
content.location: Gold Fixe Hangers. One of the lines that continues all the way out the roof.

content.description:
Make a very bouldery start, cruxing on a long pull from a undercling to a good drilled? 3-finger pocket.  Make a few more moves to pass the third bolt and pull the roof to a stance at the fourth bolt.  From here it is no more than 5.9 climbing to the anchors. 

  The published grade is 12a, but this felt easier than that.  Might have a few chipped pockets.
content.location: In the middle of Main wall, this route starts between Cowgirl Diplomacy and Pretty Pastries.  Starts about 10 feet left of the low large roof.

content.description: Bolted V7 right of Sandman.  Short but fun.
Short but sustained with a variety of movement and holds.
content.location: Towards the right end of main wall, 2 routes right of Zone of Exclusion

content.description: Moving to and past the 4th bolt is cruxy.  This is a decent climb.  Several new hangers on the route. After the traverse this climb stays on you right until the end.
content.protection: Sport.  Six bolts (seven? perhaps? I will verify this) and shuts at the top.
content.location: Left end of the Main wall.  Starts in a corner, up a crack.

content.description:
In between Sacrificial Lizard and Tales from the Grypt, this climb looks 5.12, climbs 5.11, and is neglected by far too many climbers. 

  It climbs through a fairly straight forward face to a blanker looking section.  Some decent pockets and adequate crimps take you to a Grypt-esque finish, although the best holds disguise themselves better than on Grypt. 

  On a final note, in the final 10-15 feet the rock quality worsens; so climb carefully and try not to pepper your belayer.
content.protection: 9(?) bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Left end of Main Wall, between Sacrificial Lizard and Tales from the Grypt.  Starts with a high left hand crimp and right hand undercling.

content.description: Similar to neighboring routes.  Pull through a no feet start to a boulder problem through a bulge.  Then continue up easier face to the anchor.
content.location: Towards the center of the Main Wall. A little left of Bull in a China Shop.

content.description: Nice and overhanging pocket pulling. Crux is off the deck.
content.location: Under the huge roof, two climbs right from Genesis.

content.description: Begin on the drilled jug fest of Power Trip.  Just below the anchors of Power Trip traverse right to get into an awkward dihedral.  Pull an awkward roof to get established on an easier face below the anchors.  Feels like quite a step up from Power Trip.
content.location: Shares start with Power Trip.  At the anchors break right and follow two more bolts to anchors shared with Power Monger.

content.description: Tough moves from the moment you leave the ground till the 4th bolt then eases up.  Belayers need to be very attentive and watch for swinging climbers with frequent committing moves.
content.protection: 5 bolts with open hangers at the anchors
content.location: Just left of This Old Route that follows the obvious seam.  On the long flat wall left of Bats

content.description: A phenomenal pocket-pulling boulder problem start leads to a horizontal seam and less interesting climbing on nondescript holds to reach the anchors. This route is well worth doing for the powerful, extremely satisfying moves in the first 20 feet.
content.location: Near the right end of the Main Wall, the first line to the left of the popular moderate Blackened.

content.description: Fun, steep moves on big huecos and underclings give way to balancy vertical climbing on some of the most hilariously artificial pockets I've ever seen. This is a good route for rainy days.
content.location: In the second alcove from the left on the Main Wall, this route is on the right wall and is the first bolt line on the left.

content.description:
Located in the middle of the Main Wall, and just around and left from Under Attack (5.12a). This lower portion of this route is also the start for two other routes which continue out right to climb the bulging face left of Under Attack.   

  Great moves on this as you traverse out right making long moves on mostly good holds to a two-handed jug at the 4th bolt. Continue up the slightly overhanging face above (crux) on somewhat tricky pockets and the occasional edge to anchors. Stemming left past the 4th bolt supposedly lowers the rating to mid 5.11.

A great power outing if you can overlook the patched-up pock marks. (Route was previously bolted, drilled, poached, chopped, and largely filled in. Thereafter, the route was rebolted and the filled-in pockets were left unexcavated.) Please leave the route as is and do not make it easier by excavating the pockets.
content.protection: Bolts. Belayer must be vigilant, or there is a distinct possibility of a deck fall past the fourth bolt, as the ground slopes upwards.
content.location: Left of Haul of Flame.

content.description: Climb vertical face just to the left of a dihedral using pockets, edges, and the arete.
content.location: To the right of "Genesis".  Just left of a large corner/dihedral.

content.description:
This is a somewhat contrived route found one line to the right of Pretty Pasties and two to the left of Bull in a China Shop. Its most notable feature is a gigantic undercling about two thirds of the way up. 

  Grab two jugs and pull on to the wall (cheater stones may help if you're under about 5' 10"), there's a fairly blank looking section but it's pretty true to the grade, continue climbing through an easier section to the anchors.
content.protection: A handful of bolts to a two shut anchor.

content.description:
Pull off the ground and encounter the crux, a shouldery move moving from one gaston to the next.  Make a few more tricky moves to to a few nice jugs and a resting hole.  Rest well as the rest of the route is sustained and tricky on small holds.   Pull the final redpoint crux just below the final bolt and a nice resting ledge. 

  Also didn't encounter any chipped holds on this one (that I saw anyways) and the grade seemed to be solid.
content.location: Towards the far right side of Main Wall.  Starts off the large layer of flood debris using a undercling at chest height.  Between an Unknown route and Hooked on Pockets.  Second route right of This old Route.

content.description: Big moves on deep pockets are followed by slippery little crimps with bad feet to reach the ledge at bolt 3 and the end of the cruxy opening of this climb. Take advantage of this rest as there are still some solid 5.11 moves on small crimps guarding the anchor.
content.location: Starting just right of Kindest Cut, this route shares it's start with Honed Improvement but moves up and slightly left.

content.description: Bouldery start to long reach, lets up after the 4th bolt.  Stick clip first bolt.
content.location: Near the right end of Main Wall

content.description:
Start up the juggy underclings of heart shaped box to an obvious traverse right around the third or fourth bolt.  Traverse right on mostly good holds to a nice jug rail.  Set up here and enter the sequency crux, two small pockets and a big move right to a jug.  Fight the barn door get established and pull one more big move to a nice rest.  From here continue up significantly easier 5.10 climbing to the anchors. 

  One of the easier Jack's ticks at the grade.
content.location: Shares start with Heart Shaped Box and finishes on Natural Born Driller.  Starts across from Swiss arete to the left and Natural Born Driller is the right.

content.description: Start on a cheater stone and start the under clinging traverse up and right.  Make your way to the jug just before the heart shaped hold and get a shake.  You get a few options from here.  Either stem the opposing wall making it much easier, go left up the big chalky jugs, or head right up the tricky face.  Either way its fun!
content.location: The route just to the right of Swiss Arete.

content.description:
One of the longer and best of Main wall's harder lines.  This one is fairly continuous to the top of the cliff band.  Start as for Evil Offspring with a tough move off cheater stones to get on the wall. Head up on good holds through steep rock for several bolts.  Where Evil Offspring cuts right, head slightly left then straight up to the thin balancy crux. Once on the slab a nice rest presents itself.  From here head up through steep ground past another bolt to a hard clip and a tricky sequence getting established on the face above.  Get a nice rest and continue up easier ground to the anchors. 

  Probably on the lower side of 13b.  The first half is about 13a to a nice rest with a 12c finish.
content.location: Shares start with Evil Offspring.  To the left is the project "How can you call me evil" to the right is "October surprise".

content.description:
Pull off the ground using good handjams through a slightly chossy section getting up to the second bolt.  From here bust right using a collection of jams, underclings, and laybacks.  Pull around the final overhang and run up the final moves to the anchors. 

  Possible chipped pocket at the crux.
content.protection: 5? Bolts to Anchors, 1st one is currently missing a hanger.
content.location: On the left side of Mainwall look for the bolted steep right leaning crack.  Between the routes Glued, Screwed, Tatooed, and an unknown project.

content.description: Not one of the better lines on the right section of Main Wall.  Enhanced pockets lead to a forced line, that is squeezed next to "This Old Route".  The route start off fun with big pulls between big pockets on slightly steep ground.  Around the third bolt the good holds run out and you are forced to continue upwards usings some tweaky enhanced / drilled holds.  On the OS it may be difficult to not come close to converging with "This Old Route"  After this section better climbing with a surprisingly sustained nature leads to the anchors.  Much of the route is good, but the middle and it's closeness to neighboring routes detracts.
content.location: Far right side of Main Wall, just after you come out of the streambed.  To the left is "This Old Route", to the right is the classic "Kindest Cut"

content.description:
Head up steep underclings and pinches. The climbing starts out easy and gets progressively harder as you go.  Make a tricky move to obtain crimps at the lip of the roof and the fifth bolt.  Here pull a crux that starts out powerful and turns to balancy.  Expect to go past the anchors to clip them, allowing for some nice clean air if you blow it here. 

  This one feels easy to one-hang but is somehow difficult to put it together for the redpoint.  I believe this is in the guide as 12d, but feels softer. 

  Also despite the name, I didn't see any gluing or chipping on this one.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to Open Cold Shut Anchors
content.location: On the left side of Main Wall, between Twist of Cain and Hand Job.  Four routes right of the popular Sacrified Lizard, just right of a large chimney.

content.description: A stellar line and area classic. Probably one of the best 10s in the area, if not THE best.
content.location: Very first route on the leftmost side of the crag. Would be hard to miss as it's one of the only climbs on the Main Wall thats less than overhung!

content.description: Pull a difficult awkward start getting out of the streambed and get a OK stance over the roof.  Head up on steepening rock on good holds to a  big move to a jug.  Stick the jug, make a big move right, then enter the tricky dihedral up the final slab.  While this final section isn't too hard there aren't many good holds so ignore the building pump and work the footholds to get to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 Bolts to Anchors, Consider Stickclipping the second bolt
content.location: On the right side of the Mainwall, just before the streambed moves away from the wall.  Second route right of the classic "Under Attack".  To the left is "Creative Foreplay" and to the right is "Sweet Dreams" which goes up the arete.

content.description:
Get into the double undercling and shoot left to the glued-in baseball size hold.  Crank on this until it breaks off of the wall, swear a little, then haul up into the comfortized hold to clip.  Trend right off a crimp and pinch to clip again then move a little left of the bolt-line to a desparate stab into a good two-finger pocket.  Climb the rest with little difficulty.  Two split links sit at the hangers so bring an atc to rap and avoid a twisted rope. 

  Note:  As of 5/2010 I really did break off the key glued-in hold.  I have no idea what a new grade would be but it's much harder than I can climb. The baseball is nearby if anybody wants to glue it back in.
content.location: Middle of the face to the left of System In Ruins (a few right of Heart Shaped Box)

content.description: This is my favorite of the "connect the dots" routes in this grid bolted section of the Main Wall.  Start on Evil Offspring and link into the top of October Surprise, which is the bolt line just right of the Arete.  This is not listed in the newest guidebook, and the name is coined just from the two routes that are connected.
content.location: Easiest way to locate this section of wall is to look for the "diving board" feature associated with the route Unpopular Mechanics.

content.description: Starts on Haul of Flame and traverses the rail to the right and finishes up on Unpopular Mechanics.

Super steep start going from an undercling to a baseball hold and the Swiss cheese pockets below the second bolt, followed by a scrunchy move getting your feet over the lip and throwing to the gigantic ledge. Beyond the ledge is low-angle, easy climbing to the shuts. Basically a fun boulder problem with a joke finish.
content.location: In the second alcove from the left on the Main Wall, this is on the right wall of the alcove and is the third bolt line from the left. (Directly across from Unpopular Mechanics.)

content.description: Big powerful roof moves on a reasonably obvious line then follow the standard Jacks transition to thin crux moves, then eases up a couple number grades at the top.  The crux can be pulled by at least two methods, one almost straight up on pockets, the other just slightly right on a mostly invisible crimp/nub. Very likely easier than the posted grade of 12c/d but a decent amount of fun for 15 ft of hard climbing.
content.protection: Clips down low aren't as bad as book makes out.   7 bolts
content.location: Right of Total Lack of Jump, left of Shortest Straw (little ways left of the classic Swiss Arete)

content.description: Grab good holds from the top of the cheater stones and pull through the no feet start.  Do a boulder problem through a bulge and then continue up easier face to the anchor.  Good fun route!
content.location: In the center of the Main Wall.  Down a little right of Genesis.

content.description: One of the best routes I have done at Main Wall this route may even be deserving of classic status.  Make a tricky move pulling out of the streambed and getting established on the wall.  Clip the second bolt and make a sweet dyno to a large jug, from here the business starts and fun sustained cranking takes you past the next few bolts to an eventual rest.  Climb easier lower quality rock to the anchors.  Watch out for the cactus and wall that will be behind you just as you finish up the crux section.  This is one of the more sustained lines on Main Wall, and I didn't come across any obvious chipped holds.
content.location: Far right Side of Main Wall.  At the start of the last wall as you head towards the end of the wall.  To the left is Sweet Dreams and to the right is Zone of Exclusion.

content.description: This route is an area classic and one of the few moderates on the main wall.  Fun to do as a warm up for Bats in the Belfry which is just right on the next wall.
content.location: Mid-way on the Main wall just right of a down log.

content.description: Steep start with many well chalked pockets.  Climb past two bulges to anchors.  Very fun but pumpy!
content.location: Shady area just right of a very large dihedral/cove area.

content.description: Jugs, pockets, under clings, crimp jugs, and even a sloper.  This line has some fun holds to pull on.  Like a lot of routes on this wall, this route starts with a boulder problem.  After the bouldery but fun start, there's a couple buckets to recover on.  Moving off the buckets, the climbing becomes pocketed with some pockets being great and some being less than great. Find the good pockets then make one last difficult move to gain footing on the ledge by the last bolt.  From here easier climbing leads to the anchors, traverse the ledge left a little before heading up to the anchors.   Don't let the back wall intimidate you, you never get near it and of course you don't use it. You'll want to stick clip the first bolt and maybe even the second bolt to start the route.
content.location:
Located just to the right of the popular Swiss Arete and adjacent to Heart Shaped Box. 

Lowering:

  Have your belayer lower you off the rings to clean the draws.  To minimize the chance of swinging into the plants; from the third bolt, clean the draw off the second bolt then clean the third bolt and swing.  The swing is not as bad as it looks like it could be from the ground.  Most climbers should be able to reach the first bolt from the ground to clean it.

content.description: Start almost as for Genesis but climb slightly right to the first bolt.  Head up ever steepening ground on decent pockets, making a tricky move around the third bolt.  Pull on a few more good pockets and head into the crux, getting past the vertical section.  Pass this and it's easy going up to the anchors.
content.location: On the far left side of Main Wall.  Just right of the classic Genesis.

content.description: Sun and Shade. Can be windy. For the most part 5.11 and up. Has one of the best 5.10's (Genesis) in the canyon.
